Authors: Sardjono W., Sudrajat J., Retnowardhani A., Mariani
Title: Readiness model of e-learning implementation from teacher and student side at school in the pramuka Island of seribu islands - DKI jakarta
Source title: Proceedings of 2020 International Conference on Information Management and Technology, ICIMTech 2020
Affiliations: BINUS Graduate Program - Master of Information Systems Management, Bina Nusantara University, Information Systems Management Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; BINUS Entrepreneurship Center, BINUS Business School Undergraduate Program, Bina Nusantara University, Management Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Information Systems Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Sardjono, W., BINUS Graduate Program - Master of Information Systems Management, Bina Nusantara University, Information Systems Management Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Sudrajat, J., BINUS Entrepreneurship Center, BINUS Business School Undergraduate Program, Bina Nusantara University, Management Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Retnowardhani, A., BINUS Graduate Program - Master of Information Systems Management, Bina Nusantara University, Information Systems Management Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Mariani, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Information Systems Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: The relationship between the world of education and the industrial revolution 4.0 is closely related, where the world of education is required to follow the development of information systems and technology and utilize information and communication technology as a facility in the learning process so that it becomes more effective and efficient. For the Thousand Islands area, educational facilities are quite adequate, but the problem is that if you want to continue your education at the upper secondary level, students must stay on Pramuka Island, and incur additional costs. With the development of information systems and technology, making the industrial era 4.0 grow rapidly, so that and bring changes to the education sector with e-learning terminology that can provide solutions for regions in Indonesia that are still constrained in problems of access and distance so it is necessary to know the level of teacher readiness and students in schools in the Pramuka Island environment in the Thousand Islands in utilizing electronic learning. Quantitative research approaches are used and data collection uses a questionnaire with a likert scale with a population of all teachers and all school students who are on Pramuka Island, Thousand Islands. The research method uses the factor analysis method and the regression analysis method is used to build the model. The results showed the existence of ease of use e-learning application systems, rapid response from information technology support, and e-learning application systems that are easy to do if there is a change in learning material. © 2020 IEEE.
Author Keywords: A thousand islands; E-learning implementation; Learning process; Student readiness level; Teacher readiness level
Index Keywords: Computer aided instruction; Economic and social effects; Education computing; Engineering education; Information management; Information systems; Information use; Learning systems; Population statistics; Students; e-Learning application; Factor analysis method; Industrial revolutions; Information and Communication Technologies; Information systems and technologies; Information technology support; Quantitative research; Regression analysis methods; E-learning
Funding Text 1: The author would like to thank BINUS University, Indonesia and the Community Service Internal Grant Program in 2020 which has funded the implementation of e-learning in schools in the Pramuka Island environment of the Thousand Islands - DKI Jakarta by building the initial prototype of this research

Authors: Sardjono W., Selviyanti E., Perdana W.G., Sudrajat J.
Title: Modeling of development of employee performance factors and dissemination
Affiliations: Information Systems Management Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Health Department, Politeknik Negeri Jember, Jember, Indonesia; School of Environmental Science, University of Indonesia, Jakarta, Indonesia; BINUS Entrepreneurship Center, Management Departement, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Sardjono, W., Information Systems Management Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Selviyanti, E., Health Department, Politeknik Negeri Jember, Jember, Indonesia; Perdana, W.G., School of Environmental Science, University of Indonesia, Jakarta, Indonesia; Sudrajat, J., BINUS Entrepreneurship Center, Management Departement, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Abstract: Key performance indicator (KPI) are generally used by companies as a benchmark to determine how well the performance of companies that can be represented by the employee's performance. The higher performance of the employee, the better the performance of the company as well. Furthermore to be able to establish key performance indicators, there are several steps that need to be done in order to obtain measurements that compatible with the conditions of the company. In this study, key performance indicator development process will be conducted through the stages of designing a questionnaire, distributing questionnaires to the employees of Company, performing factor analysis and then developing a model of KPI. The output of this study are new factors that affect employee performance and a model of KPI that can be used as a reference in forming a company's KPI. Once key performance indicators are formed, companies can take advantage of the knowledge management system for dissemination process of KPI. © Published under licence by IOP Publishing Ltd.
Index Keywords: Knowledge based systems; Knowledge management; Personnel rating; Surveys; Employee performance; Key performance indicators; Knowledge management system; Benchmarking
Funding Text 1: Thank you to Bina Nusantara University for giving us the opportunity and support to conduct research.

Authors: Meiryani, Suzan L., Sudrajat J., Joemsittiprasert W.
Title: Impact of accounting information system and intensity of energy on energy consumption in sugar industry of indonesia: Moderating role of effectiveness of supply chain
Source title: International Journal of Energy Economics and Policy
Affiliations: Department of Accounting, Faculty of Economics and Communication, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Department of Accounting, Faculty of Economics and Business, Telkom University, Bandung, Indonesia; BINUS Entrepreneuship Center, Management Departement, BINUS Business School, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Division of Business Administration, ASA College, New York, United States
Authors with affiliations: Meiryani, Department of Accounting, Faculty of Economics and Communication, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Suzan, L., Department of Accounting, Faculty of Economics and Business, Telkom University, Bandung, Indonesia; Sudrajat, J., BINUS Entrepreneuship Center, Management Departement, BINUS Business School, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Joemsittiprasert, W., Division of Business Administration, ASA College, New York, United States
Abstract: The goal of the existing study is to explore the impact of accounting information system (AIS) and intensity of energy on the effective energy consumption of the sugar industry in Indonesia. The goal also consist upon the moderating role of effectiveness of supply chain on the links of AIS and effective energy consumption, intensity of energy and effective energy consumption. The employees that are related with AIS and supply chain are the respondent and they provide the data by questionnaires and the data was evaluated by employing the effective tool of data analysis named as Smart-PLS. The results show that AIS and intensity of energy have positive link with the effective energy consumption. The findings also show that effectiveness of supply chain positively moderates among the links of AIS and effective energy consumption, intensity of energy and effective energy consumption. The policymakers and the upcoming researchers will be the users of this study who can get guidelines in developing regulation regarding effective energy consumption and also in exploration of this area in future. © 2020, Econjournals. All rights reserved.
Author Keywords: Accounting Information System; Effective Energy Consumption; Intensity of Energy; Supply Chain
Funding Text 1: This work is supported by DIPA Kementerian Riset dan Teknologi/ Badan Riset dan Inovasi Nasional T.A. 2020, Republic of

Authors: Meiryani, Olivia, Sudrajat J., Daud Z.M.
Title: The effect of firm's size on corporate performance
Source title: International Journal of Advanced Computer Science and Applications
Affiliations: Accounting Department, Faculty of Economics and Communication, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; BINUS Entrepreneuship Center, Management Departement BINUS Business School, Undergraduate Program Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Department of Accounting and Finance, Faculty of Economics and Management, Universiti Putra, Malaysia

Abstract: The purpose of this study is to determine the effect of capital structure on firm's financial performance that is conducted on 55 manufacturing sector listed companies in Indonesia Stock Exchange. The data analysis is conducted using R Studio software. Study is used data panel analysis with random effect model. The result of this study are (1) firm's size has no effect on firm's financial performance which is proxied by return-on-assets; (2) firm's size has no effect on firm's financial performance which is proxied by market-to-book-value. © 2020 Science and Information Organization.
Author Keywords: Financial performance; Firm size; Market to book value; Return on assets
Funding Text 1: Thanks to BINUS University Jakarta Indonesia.

Authors: Meiryani, Suzan L., Sudrajat J., Warganegara D.L.
Title: The effect of management style on accounting information systems
Source title: International Journal of Innovation, Creativity and Change
Affiliations: Accounting Department, Faculty of Economics and Communication, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Accounting Department, Faculty of Economics and Business, Telkom University, Bandung, 40257, Indonesia; BINUS Entrepreneurship Center, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Accounting and Finance Department, Faculty of Economics and Communication, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Meiryani, Accounting Department, Faculty of Economics and Communication, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Suzan, L., Accounting Department, Faculty of Economics and Business, Telkom University, Bandung, 40257, Indonesia; Sudrajat, J., BINUS Entrepreneurship Center, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Warganegara, D.L., Accounting and Finance Department, Faculty of Economics and Communication, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: Management style is a complex concept. It is identified as a factor that can succeed or thwart the achievement of quality of a financial reporting system. The purpose of this study is to investigate through testing confirmation of management style influence on the quality of financial reporting systems. It was statistically processed using simple regression analysis. The research method used explanatory research method to get basic answers of causation by analysing the causes of the problems on the quality of financial reporting systems. The results of this study show that management style influences the quality of financial reporting systems and the problems of financial reporting systems which has not qualified occur because of the financial reporting systems which are less qualified, less integrated, less efficient and have not achieved optimal access. The financial reporting systems which have not qualified are because the management style does not fully guarantee the implementation of financial reporting systems. © 2020, Primrose Hall Publishing Group.
Author Keywords: Accounting information systems; Financial reporting; Management; Quality; Style
Funding Text 1: This work is supported by DIPA Kementerian Riset dan Teknologi/Badan Riset dan Inovasi Nasional T.A. 2020, Republic of Indonesia as a part of Research Grant of INSINAS entitled “Rancangan Sistem Informasi Inventory Online Berbasis Android Bagi UMKM Pada Sektor Dagang” or “Design of Android-Based Online Inventory Information System for Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises (MSMEs) in Trade Sector”.

Authors: Meiryani, Amri M.A., Sudrajat J., Riantono I.E.
Title: The effect of financial target and financial stability on fraudulent financial statements
Affiliations: Accounting Department, Faculty of Economics and Communication, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Binus Entrepreneuship Center, Management Departement, BINUS Business School Undergraduate Program, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Meiryani, Accounting Department, Faculty of Economics and Communication, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Amri, M.A., Accounting Department, Faculty of Economics and Communication, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Sudrajat, J., Binus Entrepreneuship Center, Management Departement, BINUS Business School Undergraduate Program, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Riantono, I.E., Accounting Department, Faculty of Economics and Communication, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: The purpose of this study was to analyze fraudulent financial statements with fraud pentagon on mining sector public listed company, calculated using fraud score model. This study used secondary data from official website of Indonesian Stock Exchange. Samples were selected by purposive sampling method. The analytical method used in this observation is regression data panel analysis using Eviews 10 software. The results of this study indicate that Financial Target effect on fraudulent financial statements. Meanwhile Financial Stability no effect on fraudulent financial statement. © 2019 by Advance Scientific Research. This is an open-access article under the CC BY license (http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/4.0/)
Author Keywords: Financial Stability; Financial Statement; Financial Target; Fraud
Funding Text 1: This work is supported by Research Technological Transfer Office (RTTO) BINUS University 2020 funding, as a part of Research Grant of Penelitian Internasional Binus (PIB)/ International Binus Research (PIB) entitled “Quality of Accounting Information Systems and Their Emerging Contributions of Public Listed Companies”.

Title: Designing a web based quality of accounting information system
Source title: International Journal of Scientific and Technology Research
Affiliations: Accounting Department, Faculty of Economics and Communication, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, India; BINUS Entrepreneurship Center, Management Departement, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, India
Authors with affiliations: Meiryani, Accounting Department, Faculty of Economics and Communication, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, India; Sudrajat, R., BINUS Entrepreneurship Center, Management Departement, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, India
Abstract: Recording of transactions an d financial reports that are still manual on small and medium micro businesses creates the risk of errors in financial records that are not rigorous, irrelevant, incorrect and not reliable, and creates difficulties with the increasing transactions that wil l occur in the future. This study aims to design a quality accounting information system model needed by small and medium micro businesses i n order to assist business operations. This research is a research and development research with the method of devel oping rapid application development (RAD) which consists of three phases that require planning, RAD workshop design and implementation. Data collection techniques used were interviews, observation, documentation, literature study. The results of this study indicate that small and medium micro businesses in Indonesia still use manual cash receipt accounting information systems. Documents used in the form of cash notes and invoices, while the notes made are records of ca sh sales, accounts receivable, and inve ntory. However, recording is not done routinely so that financial information / reports are inaccurate. Designing a quality a ccounting information system can simplify and speed up the making of financial statements. © 2019, International Journal of Scientific and Technology Research. All rights reserved.
Author Keywords: Accounting informa tion systems; Design; Quality; Rapid Application Development; Small and medium micro businesses

Title: The effect of environmental complexity on the quality of accounting information systems: Integration, flexibility and accessibility dimensions
Affiliations: Accounting Department, Faculty of Economics and Communication, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Accounting Department, Faculty of Economics and Business, Padjadjaran University, Bandung, Indonesia; BINUS Entrepreneurship Center, Management Departement, BINUS Business School Undergraduate Program, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Meiryani, Accounting Department, Faculty of Economics and Communication, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Susanto, A., Accounting Department, Faculty of Economics and Business, Padjadjaran University, Bandung, Indonesia; Sudrajat, J., BINUS Entrepreneurship Center, Management Departement, BINUS Business School Undergraduate Program, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: The quality management accounting information system will produce quality management accounting information. Environmental complexity can improve the quality of management accounting information systems. This study aims to measure how much influence the environmental complexity on the quality of management accounting information systems on the quality of management accounting information systems. This study uses a survey method, is descriptive and verification, carried out on the analysis unit of the company owned by the state-owned enterprises in Indonesia. For the purpose of data analysis using SEM-PLS. the results of the study show that environmental complexity influences the quality of management accounting information systems. © 2019 Association for Computing Machinery.
Author Keywords: Accessibility; Environmental Complexity; Flexibility; Integration; Management Accounting Information Systems
Index Keywords: Environmental management; Information systems; Information use; Integration; Quality management; Accessibility; Accounting Information Systems; Environmental complexity; Flexibility; Indonesia; Management accounting; State owned enterprise; Survey methods; Information management

Authors: Sudrajat J., Rahman M.A., Guzman G.A., Ricky M.Y., Sasongko A.H.
Title: Innovation of entrepreneurship learning with business model canvas game
Authors with affiliations: Sudrajat, J., Bina Nusantara University, Indonesia; Rahman, M.A., Bina Nusantara University, Indonesia; Guzman, G.A., Bina Nusantara University, Indonesia; Ricky, M.Y., Bina Nusantara University, Indonesia; Sasongko, A.H., Bina Nusantara University, Indonesia
Abstract: This study aims to produce entrepreneurship learning model using Business Model Canvas Games to improve information and communication technology content in entrepreneurship learning process. The expected benefit of this research is to be useful for educational institutions to develop entrepreneurial learning models, and the specific targets to be achieved from this research are expected to be useful for the Binus Entrepreneurship Centre (BEC) unit to create innovative entrepreneurship development. Learning process, Participants of this research are students of Binus Game Application Program who have taken EN001 and EN002 subjects. This research uses Research and Development method. The results prove that students can understand BMC by creating prototype BMC Games products, in the form of game software applications to facilitate socialization to students and lecturers EN001 and EN002. Based on a survey of 34 students who have attended entrepreneurial courses at Binus University, they found that 76.5% said it was interesting to learn entrepreneurship using the concept of games or business model applications on smartphones. 17.6% said unattractive, 5.9% did not comment. © 2018, Allied Business Academies. All rights reserved.
Author Keywords: Business model canvas games; Improve learning; Learning entrepreneurship
References: Abrams, R., (2008) What Business Should I Start?
